0.Pros: Best hours available you could make as much as you need. You get to meet and work with all sorts of different people
0.Cons: They don't offer much it's a dead end job I know people that's been working there for 20 years yes the make 13$ hour but that's not enough to live and save a little

1.Pros: It is a good starting point job that didn't need any prior experience. It was my first job when I was in high school.
1.Cons: It's a fast pace work day. Your work is not easy and your under appreciated by customers and sometimes employees.

2.Pros: Flexible hours, nice coworkers and managers, discounts on food, good benefits, the pay isn't that bad
2.Cons: A lot of the customers can be really rude, you are on your feet the whole shift so it can be tiring

3.Pros: I learned a lot and worked well with everyone. I had good managers and co workers. Most customers were nice.
3.Cons: I wish I learned more about grill and the back of the house. I got stuck in one position most of the time. Doing single booth was very hectic.

4.Pros: After being there 5 years there was no pros. Other than getting to meet new people.
4.Cons: The list is very long. After being a manager for 5 years I could no longer find a restaurant management job anywhere else. Other companys saw McDonalds and would say no on the spot. Even though I have a degree in restaurant management. The store managers are forced to pick people to throw into management training. Most that are picked have no business being in a manager position.

5.Pros: The pros of working for this company is that everything is relativeley easy with flexible schedules and is an overall good work expirience with everything that you learn
5.Cons: The biggest cons of this jobs is that the pay is very mediocre in correlation to the amount of work you actuall do

6.Pros: + it more fast pace than the average job+ being able to eat there ( if you like fast food)+ Location friendly ( they are everywhere)+ meeting young workers
6.Cons: +dealing with rude customers+ dealing with untimely workers and slackers+ odd hours+ The get used to the food and would not want to eat there outside of work.

7.Pros: 1.)I'm generally a happy people person so working with others was a pro for me2.) Opportunity for raises3.) Easy to get accepted
7.Cons: 1.) Every manager has a different going about things like techniques or the way you are cleaning something.2.) Little to no training

8.Pros: I love the people I work with. They are so nice and funny. That is the only reason I survive.
8.Cons: The customers are so rude. It's just a job to get a few bucks, I won't do it for the rest of my life.

9.Pros: Great experience working at this location
